title: Fäsi 2013 Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: Cola and slightly overripe aromas of raisin and fig are blanketed with oaky mocha and cocoa. This is syrupy in feel, with not much structural or acidic support. Thus you get a rich, creamy set of chocolaty berry flavors all the way through the finish.

title: Jean Laurent NV Blanc de Noirs Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: With this producer's emphasis on Pinot Noir, this wine is like the brand's signature. Crispness balances with the soft, creamy mousse and light acidity. A blend of five different vintages, it moves easily from freshness to hints of toast. Drink now.

title: Mount Veeder 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This adds 12% Malbec and 4% Petit Verdot to the mix, a burly, full-bodied expression of mountain mint, cinnamon and tenacious tannin. Juicy plum and dark cherry compete for attention amidst the strong herbal components and concentration.

title: Paris Valley Road 2015 Merlot (California)
description: Ripe, rich and full bodied, this opulent wine from a San Luis Obispo producer has plenty of fruit aromas and flavors shaded by chocolate and baking-spice nuances. It's all at a reasonable price for the level of quality.

title: Perrier Jouët NV Grand Brut  (Champagne)
description: Smooth and soft, this wine has richness and a good balance between ripe white fruits and a zesty, mineral texture. Like all good nonvintage cuvées, it is ready to drink.

title: Pietradolce 2016 Rosso Contrada Rampante  (Etna)
description: Truffle, ripe berry, rose, cocoa and Mediterranean brush aromas shape the nose. The firmly structured palate is a bit on the lean side, offering French oak, sour cherry, powdered sage and star anise set against bright acidity and firm, fine-grained tannins that leave a drying finish.

title: Planeta 2017 La Segreta Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)
description: Made entirely with Nero d'Avola, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry and Mediterranean brush. The juicy, easygoing palate delivers crushed blackberry, black cherry and a hint of carob alongside round tannins. Enjoy soon to catch the fruit richness.

title: Richard Böcking 2015 Böcking Riesling (Mosel)
description: This is a deeply mineral yet refreshingly easy-drinking wine balancing savory notes of crushed slate and honeycomb against pristine pineapple and lemon flavors. It's a zesty sip with just a hint of tangerine sweetness. The finish is brisk, ending on a pleasantly bitter touch of lemon zest.

title: Salomon-Undhof 2016 Brut Nature Rosé Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: A most subtle glimpse of creamy cherry is all that appears on the shy nose. The frothy, fresh palate is equally light but adds some phenolic grip. This is very fresh, easy and beautifully dry. Drink soon.

title: San Simeon 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Light in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of candied pomegranate, sweet sage, bay leaf and crushed hibiscus, with a touch of graphite minerality. It's fresh and bright on the palate, where cherry is dashed with dried herbs and white pepper.

title: Shaw 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Creamy aromas of butterscotch and candied corn are shot through with a vitalizing kick of lemon zest on the nose. The smooth, textured palate is bright and citrus-forward, with creamy, savory elements that broaden the feel and linger on the finish.

title: The Archivist 2016 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Fruity aromas of cherry, hibiscus and pomegranate grow more complex with wood spice, slate and clay on the nose of this widely available bottling. Full flavors of dried cherry and pomegranate juice meet with sagebrush and bay leaf on the palate.

title: Two Hands 2015 Sexy Beast Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: Raspberry, chocolate, ripe plum, black pepper and a briny, black olive tang lead this wine into a palate that's equally savory and tangy. A little on the hot and rich side, the acidity just about keeps things afloat.

title: Vignobles Berthier 2016 Les Chasseignes  (Sancerre)
description: One of a series of wines that the producers calls Les Parcellaires, single-vineyard wines, this is an impressively perfumed wine, exotic in character. It is rich with just the lightest hints of purer acidity. Drink the wine now.

title: Vincent Grall 2016 Le Manoir  (Sancerre)
description: A ripe wine, full of delicious fruit flavors and acidity, this has a chalky texture as well as rich white fruits tightly cut with acidity. It is ready to drink.

title: Wagner 2016 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: An intensely stony nose of wet slate and lime zest carries to the equally expressive palate. This is light in feel but electric with acidity, ending dry on tones of citrus zest and chalk.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2017  Pouilly-Fumé
description: This wine is rich and full of apple flavors along with warm acidity. Like many wines from this appellation, it is still young after a year and needs to open up its ripe fruits. Drink from 2019.

title: Antichi Vinai 1877 2017 Petralava Rosato (Etna)
description: Aromas of woodland berry, sea breeze and Mediterranean brush lift out of the glass. The succulent palate doles out wild strawberry, crushed raspberry and white pepper before a fresh, saline close.

title: Antonio Caggiano 2014 Vigna Machia dei Goti  (Taurasi)
description: Aromas of game, wild herb, mature black-skinned fruit and a whiff of barnyard follow over to the dense, extracted palate along with prune and licorice. It's on the funky, overripe side, with a velvety texture that gives way to a dusty, drying finish. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit flavors and freshness.

title: Argyle 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This hits the nose with some sharply spicy aromas, then opens up broadly with ripe cherry fruit. There's a wash of chocolate to help smooth out a touch of bitter herb. Drink now through the early 2020s.
